intro: Castilleja arvensis var. arvensis, commonly known as the field milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant that belongs to the Orobanchaceae family. It is characterized by its bright red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as fields, meadows, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies. Its leaves are alternate and often have a glandular appearance, while its stems are usually sprawling or ascending. Castilleja arvensis var. arvensis relies on other plants for some of its nutrients, making it an important component of certain ecological systems.
